mapper.select: SELECT b.user_no, a.auth_seq, a.up_auth_seq, a.auth_cd, a.auth_nm, a.auth_type_cd, DECODE(B.auth_seq, NULL,'N','Y') select_yn FROM tb_auth a left outer join tb_user_auth b on a.auth_seq= b.auth_seq and b.user_no = #{userNo} left outer join tb_user c on b.user_no =c.user_no where a.use_yn= 'Y'
mapper.insert:
SELECT lpad( nvl(MAX(USER_NO),0)+1, 9,'0') from tb_user
insert into tb_user ( USER_NO, USER_ID, USER_NM, user_PWD, user_EMAIL, TEL_NO, MOBILE, RGSTP_NO, RGST_DTTM ) values ( #{userNo}, #{userId} , #{userNm} , #{userPwd} , #{userEmail} , #{telNo} , #{mobile} , #{userNo}, sysdate )

SELECT nvl(MAX(user_auth_seq ),0)+1 from TB_USER_AUTH
insert into TB_USER_AUTH ( user_auth_seq, rgstp_no , auth_seq , user_no , rgst_dttm ) values ( #{userAuthSeq}, #{userNo} , #{authSeq} , #{userNo} , sysdate )
mapper.update: UPDATE TB_USER SET user_email= #{userEmail}, updtp_no=#{userNo}, user_id= #{userId}, user_nm=#{userNm}, user_pwd=#{userPwd}, user_no=#{userNo}, updt_dttm=sysdate WHERE user_no=#{userNo}
